column5: å˜åŒ– (biÃ nhuÃ )Means change or transformation, and it can refer to a wide range of changes, including physical, emotional, or situational changes.æ¢ (huÃ n)Means to exchange, replace, or switch. It specifically refers to the action of replacing one thing with another.For example, you could use å˜åŒ– (biÃ nhuÃ ) to describe the changes in weather, but you would use æ¢ (huÃ n) when talking about exchanging currency.

column5: å·® (chÃ )Means different, distinct, or disparate. It can also mean to lack or be deficient in something.å (huÃ i)Means bad, negative, or unfavorable. It specifically refers to the quality or condition of something being undesirable or not in good condition.For example, you could use å·® (chÃ ) to describe the difference between two options, but you would use å (huÃ i) to describe the quality of a product or the condition of a situation.

It is a more general term and can be used in various contexts, such as everyday conversation, storytelling, or expressing an opinion.For example, you would use è®² (jiÇng) when referring to giving a lecture or presentation, while è¯´ (shuÅ) is used in everyday conversation or when expressing thoughts or opinions.
